subject: Re: [junit] Re: Creating JUnit class using WSAD, Help Required !!!!!
msgSnippet: ... Do you know that JUnit tests are just Java classes? You could just create a Java class that extends junit.framework.TestCase. Alternatively, try New
messageBody:
junit_user2004 wrote:

> Hi Rainsberger,
> Am using WSAD 5.0 and i have already installed my project on it. I
> dont know how to write test classes for my java files using WSAD.
> Which plug in or configurations i need to change to get enable my
> WSAD for writing Junit test classes.

Do you know that JUnit tests are just Java classes? You could just
create a Java class that extends junit.framework.TestCase.

Alternatively, try New > JUnit > Test Case, which just brings up a
slightly more "wizard" like interface for creating a TestCase class. (It
fills in the "extends" part for you, and allows stubs for setUp() and
tearDown()).

If you are brand new to JUnit as well, you should consider reading some
online tutorials. Google "JUnit guide".
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
